attributes.action: Show UK support for a two-state solution by funding Israel & Palestine equally.
attributes.background: HM Government has recently expressed its unflinching support for Israel's right to exist, but in a way that could be interpreted as ignoring the plight of ordinary Palestinians dating back to the British Mandate. To avoid undermining the two-state solution policy, a more balanced approach is needed.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

The UK does not provide aid to Israel, but does provide aid to the Occupied Palestinian Territories (OPTs), and the Government has  announced £10 million of additional humanitarian aid to support civilians in the Occupied Palestinian Territories. You can find out more about this here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/uk-announces-10m-humanitarian-aid-for-civilians-in-occupied-palestinian-territories 

It's therefore not clear what changes you want the Government to make to the support it provides to Palestine.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Increase aid and support for Palestinians: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/648337 

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to provide funding to help with the rebuilding of Gaza, if that's what you want to happen.
